1.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
near, with or among; often in general, to

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
stillness; adverbially, silently; abstractly quiet, trust
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity

2.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity
defence, high fort (tower), refuge, Misgab, a place in Moab
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)

3.brief: as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
where?; hence, whither?, when?; also hither and thither
properly, to break in upon, i.e. to assail
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, to dash in pieces, i.e. kill (a human being), especially to murder
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a wall (as built in a trench)
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
a circumvallation; by implication, an inclosure

an elevation or leprous scab; figuratively, elation or cheerfulness; exaltation in rank or character
to advise; reflexively, to deliberate or resolve
to push off; used in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (to expel, mislead, strike, inflict, etc.)
to be pleased with; specifically, to satisfy adebt
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
to be (causatively, make) light, literally (swift, small, sharp, etc.) or figuratively (easy, trifling, vile, etc.)

emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb
